    Our role is to provide support and guidance to funeral firms and the bereaved families in their care. FUNERAL ADVICE JOIN NOW

    NAFD

    The National Association of Funeral Directors is an inclusive and progressive voice for the funeral profession and bereaved people in all four nations of the United Kingdom.

    We promote high standards, provide members with resources to support them in delivering high standards of care for bereaved and deceased people – and ensure consumers have the information they need to make informed decisions when arranging a funeral.

    Find a
    funeral director

    All funeral directors reviewed independently. Endorsed by the National Association of Funeral Directors.

    NAFD Annual Review 2023

    The NAFD’s 2023 Annual Review highlights the work of the Association in advocacy, standards, education, communications, events and member support during a turbulent and challenging period.

    It explores how the association seeks to work with its members, the wider funerals and bereavement sector and with local, regional and national governments, across the UK, to provide support and information to bereaved people and ensure the funeral directors caring for them do so to the highest professional standards.

        The National Association of Funeral Directors is an inclusive and progressive voice for the funeral profession and bereaved people in all four nations of the United Kingdom.

        We promote high standards, provide members with resources to support them in delivering high standards of care for bereaved and deceased people – and ensure consumers have the information they need to make informed decisions when arranging a funeral.

        All funeral directors reviewed independently. Endorsed by the National Association of Funeral Directors.

        NAFD Annual Review 2023

        The NAFD’s 2023 Annual Review highlights the work of the Association in advocacy, standards, education, communications, events and member support during a turbulent and challenging period.

        It explores how the association seeks to work with its members, the wider funerals and bereavement sector and with local, regional and national governments, across the UK, to provide support and information to bereaved people and ensure the funeral directors caring for them do so to the highest professional standards.
